image.altText: A sign reading Yatala Labour Prison behind blurred greenery

items.synopsis: Police charge a male inmate with murder following the death of another prisoner at Yatala Labour Prison on Saturday evening.

title.children: Prisoner charged with murder after fellow inmate dies at SA prison

image.altText: A young man in a black face mask walks while surrounded by Indonesian police

items.synopsis: A 57-second video of a shocking assault kicked off a chain of events that ended the career of an Indonesian tax official and saw his 20-year-old son accused of beating a boy at the behest of his young girlfriend.

title.children: The scandal consuming Indonesia involves rich kids, a luxury Jeep and a shocking act of violence

image.altText: A $28 pumpkin superimposed onto a fuel bowser.

items.synopsis: In remote Australia, supply chains can stretch for thousands of kilometres, which means the cost of freighting fresh food is stretching budgets to breaking point.

title.children: Why a pumpkin costs $28, a 1.25L bottle of Coke is $7, and diesel is $3.37 a litre in this community

image.altText: Bouquets of flowers on the ground.

items.synopsis: Nine people remain in hospital one week after the shocking bus crash that killed 10 wedding guests, as the nation continues to come to terms with what happened.

title.children: One week on from the Hunter Valley bus crash which devastated the nation, here's what we know so far

image.altText: Aerial shot of giant floating gas plant

items.synopsis: Off Australia's north coast, two of the world's energy titans are entwined in a fierce duel. How it came to pass is as much a story about corporate egos as it is flawed strategies.

title.children: Billions on the line as ego trumps 'logic' in race for Australian energy prize

image.altText: A phone box with police tape around it and a police van

items.synopsis: South Australia Police say they have now found a woman who called triple-0 from a public phone box in Adelaide's north-east on Friday in a distressed state, telling the operator she had recently given birth.

title.children: Woman found after distressed emergency call from SA phone box

image.altText: Patrick Dangerfield concentrates as he kicks the football

items.synopsis: Geelong captain Patrick Dangerfield joins the list of South Australians affected by the state's ramping crisis, as he is forced to wait in a ramped ambulance outside the Royal Adelaide Hospital with a partially collapsed lung and a cracked rib after sustaining an injury in Thursday night's match.

title.children: Patrick Dangerfield among patients forced to wait outside RAH as SA's ramping crisis worsens

image.altText: Kylie Minogue sits on a red chair in a yard with dancers.

items.synopsis: Kylie Minogue's most dedicated fans have long been those in the queer community. Now, decades into her career, a new generation is discovering Australia's queen of pop on TikTok, and it couldn't have come at a better time.

title.children: Kylie Minogue has the song of the summer in America — and she threw out the old rulebook to get it there

image.altText: A white man with light brown hair stands outside and holds his cat and looks lovingly at it.

items.synopsis: Home was an affirming place when Kai and Noah came out. They want the same in Australian schools, but educators say more training is needed to learn how.

title.children: Kai wants other trans kids to feel safe and included at school

image.altText: A woman standing on the seaside with an ice-cream in her hand

items.synopsis: Unmarried women in China are banned from using assisted reproductive technologies, but these women are taking matters into their own hands.

title.children: 'Don't tell anyone about it, ever': Why unmarried Chinese women are freezing their eggs overseas

image.altText: He stands in a dark blue shirt in front of a sign saying 'Cosmo' painted like the Aboriginal flag

items.synopsis: Sealing the 2,700-kilometre Outback Way could be good for remote artists. It could also bring more tourism, traffic, jobs and freight.

title.children: Sealing a road across inland Australia could forever change our most remote communities

subjects.title: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art

image.altText: Narelda Jacobs, wearing a denim jacket, poses for a photo holding her palm to the trunk of a paperbark tree

items.synopsis: With Australia's Voice referendum looming, I went back through the archives to learn more about the work my father did to bring us to this moment. But he was also ultra-conservative, and I didn't have to dig far to uncover his homophobia, writes Narelda Jacobs.

title.children: My dad fought for rights of First Nations people. But while researching his legacy, I uncovered hate in his teachings

image.altText: England bowler Stuart Broad shouts in joy as Australia batter David Warner throws his head back after getting out in the Ashes.

items.synopsis: Usman Khawaja scored his first century in England and Stuart Broad showed why he is one of the Ashes most deadly bowlers, despite a rare mistake. Here's five things you missed from overnight at Edgbaston.

title.children: Five highlights from the Ashes Test: Khawaja's latest milestone and a familiar tale for Warner

image.altText: A collage of three cricket players looking disappointed.

items.synopsis: The battle between Stuart Broad and David Warner has been a one-way street in the Ashes — but it's still not the worst "bunny" record in Test matches.

title.children: Broad has knocked over Warner again — but which batter has the worst bunny record in Test history?

image.altText: Russian President Vladimir Putin meets African leaders.

items.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin interrupts opening remarks by African leaders seeking to mediate in the Ukraine conflict to deliver a list of reasons he believed many of their proposals were misguided.

title.children: Vladimir Putin interrupts African leaders pushing for peace plan in Ukraine

image.altText: A smiling man wearing a navy suit and holding state budget papers stands in front of a glass window

items.synopsis: South Australia is on track to reach a debt figure of $37.6 billion within the next four years, in what the opposition has described as "astronomical". But Treasurer Stephen Mullighan says it's below what has been previously predicted.

title.children: South Australia's budget shows the state's debt is growing. Here's why it's in the red

image.altText: 8 men in 1940s casual attire lean against wood hut in pow camp Nangwarry SA

items.synopsis: A few old slabs of concrete buried deep in pine forests are all that remain of south-east South Australia's prisoner of war camps. But their history is being uncovered by new research that shines a light on the stories of the men interned in the region.

title.children: How Italian prisoners of war and Australian families kept 'strong bonds' of friendship after WWII

image.altText: a composite image of two women with their babies

items.synopsis: The Australian Academy of Science's chief executive says when she was leading calls for a change to how science and justice interact in court, she had no idea she was echoing comments made 40 years earlier.

title.children: 'It's the same issue': Two mothers convicted for murder faced the same legal blind spot decades apart

image.altText: A black sign on a fence with white text that reads "Now hiring: Sign writer/installer, CNC operator, fabricator".

items.synopsis: With increasing signs the economy is already slowing sharply, and many economists now saying a recession is more likely than not, why is jobs growth so strong and unemployment falling, asks Michael Janda.

title.children: The jobs market is strong for now, but unemployment will be the last indicator of recession

image.altText: Composite image of Lauren Jackson, basketball and marijuana plants

items.synopsis: Lauren Jackson was granted an exemption to take medicinal cannabis when she made a fairytale comeback to basketball. But its use — both within and outside sport — remains stigmatised while Australia's laws are difficult to understand and navigate.

title.children: More Australians are using medicinal cannabis than ever before. Is it effective for pain, and is it legal to take?

image.altText: Women wearing swimmers stand at the base of waterfall

items.synopsis: Is it secret women's business? No, it's women reaching out to make friends. When Tahlia Russell started a social media group for women in her region little did she know quite how popular it would become, with thousands joining within months.

title.children: Feeling disconnected, Tahlia created a social media group to make new friends — 5,000 women joined in six months

image.altText: Two men crouched over a coffin with a woman wrapped in a sheet inside.

items.synopsis: The family of the Ecuadorian 76-year-old continues to investigate why the woman was declared dead, before knocking on her coffin five hours into her wake.

title.children: Woman declared dead again … a week after knocking on her coffin at her own wake

image.altText: Three children, their mum and dad and their grandparents wave while standing on a balcony.

items.synopsis: King Charles III rides on horseback to inspect soldiers in the Trooping the Colour parade, which has been held since 1760.

title.children: King Charles celebrates first Trooping the Colour parade as sovereign

image.altText: A woman holds her hands on her head as she prepares to swim.

items.synopsis: Mollie O'Callaghan dominates the pool at the world championship trials, but the Queenslander says she is disappointed with her 100m freestyle win over Emma McKeon.

title.children: 'I'm quite a bit disappointed': O'Callaghan downcast despite blitzing 100m freestyle

image.altText: Usman Khawaja clenches both fists and yells in delight

items.synopsis: Not only did Usman Khawaja's Edgbaston century tick a massive box for his own career, it kept his team alive in the Ashes opener and handed his teammates a blueprint on how to approach the series.

title.children: Khawaja keeps Australia alive at Edgbaston, conquering his final career demon in the process

image.altText: A man and woman stand with a cow.

items.synopsis: A retired Queensland cattleman and a media personality from Adelaide are working together to tackle rural poverty in Cambodia.

title.children: How an Australian charity is breaking the poverty cycle, one cow at a time in Cambodia

image.altText: A person with short grey hair and glasses resting their chin in their hand

items.synopsis: Kris Kneen, the award-winning Australian author of four memoirs, including recent release Fat Girl Dancing, shares advice from their own experience.

title.children: They say we all have a book in us — but how do we get it out? A top memoir writer shares tips

image.altText: A man in a white shirt witting iwth a hooded vest pulled over his face.

items.synopsis: Advocates say such accommodation has no security of tenure, discourages independence, lacks privacy, and shouldn't be over-relied on for people with disability.

title.children: 'There is no other option': Hundreds of Queenslanders with intellectual disabilities are sleeping in boarding houses every night

image.altText: a helicopter flies above a village and giant rock face

items.synopsis: Relieved residents of a village in south-east Switzerland say a huge rock mass, which was feared would fall and destroy their homes, has come down but stopped just short of their settlement.

title.children: Rockfall narrowly misses Swiss village

image.altText: Bwera General hospital

items.synopsis: Police say rebels from the Allied Democratic Forces carried out the raid, burning down a dormitory and abducting an unknown number or people.

title.children: Militants attack school in Uganda, killing at least 41, including 38 students

image.altText: A man walks while smoke rises above buildings after aerial bombardment

items.synopsis: The attack is one of the deadliest of the clashes in urban areas of Khartoum and elsewhere in Sudan between the military and a powerful paramilitary group known as the Rapid Support Forces.

title.children: Air strike kills at least 17 in Sudan's capital, including five children

image.altText: a man hugs another man who is behind bras and is crying

items.synopsis: Nine men from Egypt, aged between 20 and 40 years old, were arrested, detained and charged on Friday, for people smuggling and participating in a criminal enterprise.

title.children: Death toll for Greek shipwreck rises to 500, as survivors reunite on mainland

image.altText: Two professional cyclists on bicycles talk amid a crowd of cyclists.

items.synopsis: The team made the announcement on Saturday, two days after Mäder's death during the final descent on stage five of the eight-day race.

title.children: Bahrain Victorious team, others withdraw from Tour de Suisse after Gino Mäder's death

image.altText: A coach and players of a Super Netball team hug and smile after a win in the team's final game.

items.synopsis: The Fever will have to defend their Super Netball crown via a knockout final after being stunned 65-62 by Collingwood in Launceston, as the Thunderbirds down the Swifts in Sydney.

title.children: Fever shocked in Magpies' last-ever Super Netball game after Thunderbirds down the Swifts

image.altText: a mother holds her baby son high in the air, they are both smiling and laughing

items.synopsis: Little Eli, now aged one, was born in Brisbane, half a world away from his parents' homeland of Ukraine. Mum Daryna is thankful her little boy has so far been shielded from the terror of war, but their family remains separated indefinitely.

title.children: Daryna fled Ukraine alone, pregnant and frightened. So far, her family has only had a few days together
